BJJ Scout method: analyze lead-up, not just the moment

contract.title: The 80/20 Rule for Learning from Social Interactions
contract.thesis: Most of a field report teaches you nothing - learning is concentrated in the 20% of moments where something actually shifted.
contract.targetReader: Practitioners who write field reports and want to extract more learning from fewer notes.
mustInclude: The 80/20 rule applied to learning (Pareto principle)
BJJ 'off the move' analysis as concrete analogy
Sports psychology research on focused debriefs
contract.tone: Analytical and credible. Third-person perspective with concrete examples.

sections.purpose: Hook the reader with the counterintuitive claim that most notes are useless
Make the abstract concrete with BJJ 'off the move' analysis
Show HOW to identify the 20% - emotional markers
Add credibility with sports psychology evidence
Give reader actionable steps to implement
Address 'but what if I miss something important?'
Reinforce thesis and create urgency to apply it
